intro: Harpagophytum dimidiatum, commonly known as the "devil's claw," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and has adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green. Harpagophytum dimidiatum is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional African medicine.
